ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed a more concrete understanding of how to build an original research project, specifically how to ask manageable research questions, and frame a literature review.

I can't really imagine a reason not to complete the intensive major. You get to learn about a topic of interest at a deeper level, engage with it creatively to complete a new and unique project, and it's not much more work than taking two alternative classes during your senior semesters.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The deadlines and structure were very helpful to keep us on track.

I can't really imagine a reason not to complete the intensive major. You get to learn about a topic of interest at a deeper level, engage with it creatively to complete a new and unique project, and it's not much more work than taking two alternative classes during your senior semesters.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes,  if you're a senior sociology major deciding between the one semester or year-long thesis, at least shop this course. Doing your project for a year lets you really dig into a topic you're interested in.

I can't really imagine a reason not to complete the intensive major. You get to learn about a topic of interest at a deeper level, engage with it creatively to complete a new and unique project, and it's not much more work than taking two alternative classes during your senior semesters.
